attributes.action: let the Chagos Islanders return home
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We are sickened by today's 3-2 decision by the Law Lords to overturn previous legal decisions to allow resettlement of the outer Chagos Islands.

We draw your attention to the comments of the dissenting judges, especially Lord Bingham's assertion that the power to legislate without going to parliament is "anachronistic". 

We note that the Foreign Secretary said: "We do not seek to excuse the conduct of an earlier generation."

We believe that, in refusing to right this wrong, the Foreign Secretary and his generation are equally culpable. 

Today's decision was unjust, undemocratic, hypocritical and immoral.

We do not believe that it is in the national interest for the UK to abuse its colonial power, under pressure from the United States. 

We urge you to overturn this decision.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
